content: Many tech companies, including GitHub, use their geographically distributed workforce as a way to steal wages from workers. They call it "location-based pay grades" and other such nonsense. But it's wrong. So we've written something you can share:

content.html: This is a symptom, not the disease. The problem is that certain market values are depressed, and if you look at the data, you'll see it's areas that are not predominately made up of white, mid-to-high class incomes. Paying based on the cost of living is about equity, actually.
content.value:
This is a symptom, not the disease.

The problem is that certain market values are depressed, and if you look at the data, you'll see it's areas that are not predominately made up of white, mid-to-high class incomes. 

Paying based on the cost of living is about equity, actually.
